[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Central Trading System (CTS) specifies requirements for managing stock trading, including processing, matching, and result generation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CTS facilitates stock trading by analyzing instructions and matching them under specified rules while interfacing with related subsystems.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CTS interfaces with trading client systems, databases, and information release modules.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: CTS provides an intuitive UI for inputting and managing trading instructions.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CTS operates on systems with Intel Core i3 or AMD Ryzen 3 processors.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: CTS supports secure communication between subsystems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CTS is optimized for systems with 8GB RAM for efficient trading operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CTS manages trading instructions and ensures consistent data handling.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CTS is configurable for various financial regulatory requirements.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CTS interoperates with APIs for enhanced trading functionalities.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 MISSING-TAG2: CTS integrates with Java-based environments using socket programming.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CTS processes buy, sell, and cancel instructions while maintaining trading logs.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CTS requires a stable internet connection and supported hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: CTS relies on Java Runtime Environment 17+ and supported operating systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Trading Instruction: Stock buy, sell, or cancel request.
Instruction Matching: Pairing compatible trade instructions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 MISSING-TAG1: CTS is designed for traders and system maintainers with intermediate technical knowledge.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall accept trading instructions from the Transaction User Interface.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall send processed trading results to the Information Release Module.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall process buy, sell, and cancel instructions (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall match instructions based on predefined rules (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall log all processed instructions for audit purposes (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The interface shall provide real-time feedback for trading actions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store trade logs for a minimum of 5 years.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall ensure data integrity during concurrent accesses.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall adhere to modular design principles for scalability.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with financial data security regulations.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain 99.9% uptime during trading hours.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: User actions shall receive feedback within 2 seconds.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process 100 instructions per second.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall handle 1,000 concurrent users without performance degradation.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Unit and integration tests validate trading operations and system reliability.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, API documentation, and example trading workflows.
[SEC] 5. References: CTS Technical Manual, Financial Data Standards, and Java Development Guidelines.
